    Index

    A B C D E F G H I L M N R S T U W 
    All Classes and Interfaces|All Packages|Constant Field Values

    A

    addBlueKey() - Method in class Inventory
    Add a blue key onto the inventory if chip acquires one
    addChips() - Method in class Inventory
    Add a chip onto the inventory if chip acquires one
    addFireBoots() - Method in class Inventory
    Add a fire boots equipment onto the inventory if chip acquires one
    addFlippers() - Method in class Inventory
    Add a flipper equipment onto the inventory if chip acquires one
    addRedKey() - Method in class Inventory
    Add a red key onto the inventory if chip acquires one
    advance() - Method in class NextLevel
    Mainly for the transitioning of levels of the game.
    applyForce(Chip, Maps) - Static method in class Tiles
    Method for force tiles, applies force depending on the direction of the force tile and places chip where force tiles end or if next tile is a wall or hazard.

    B

    BLANK - Static variable in class Tiles
    Blank tile where an empty space lies and chip can step on anytime
    BLUE_DOOR - Static variable in class Doors
    Character for Blue door tile
    BLUE_KEY - Static variable in class Inventory
    Character symbol representing the blue key objects

    C

    canAdvance(int) - Method in class NextLevel
    Accepts the collected chips of the player and decides if the player gets to pass or not.
    Chip - Class in Unnamed Package
    The Chip class represents the player in the game This class manages the player's position, inventory, interaction with other classes (collectibles, doors, hazard tiles, exit tile), and takes control of the movement of the player This class tracks where the player is alive and it tracks the type of tile below it This class interacts with other classes like Maps, Tiles, Doors, and Inventory to provide the simulation of the gameplay
    Chip(int, int) - Constructor for class Chip
    Constructor of Chip Class, creates a new Chip that accepts the starting position.
    CHIP - Static variable in class Chip
    The '@' character represents Chip / Player in the game
    CHIP - Static variable in class Inventory
    Character symbol representing the chip objects that chip needs to complete a level
    cloneMap() - Method in class Maps
    Responsible for cloning a map for purposes of restarting a level upon player death.
    collect(char) - Method in class Chip
    This method collects an item that chip '@' has crossed upon and add the said item to chip's current inventory
    Controller - Class in Unnamed Package
    The Controller class manages the flow of the game, this includes the player inputs, progression of levels leading to map transitions, and the game state.
    Controller() - Constructor for class Controller
    Constructor for Controller class initializes levels and nextLevel manager.

    D

    die() - Method in class Chip
    Set chip's attribute "alive" to false, killing him in the game
    Display - Class in Unnamed Package
    This Display class manages all the text displayed on the player's console / terminal that shows the game/menu state.
    Display() - Constructor for class Display
     
    displayInventory(Inventory, Maps) - Method in class Display
    Shows the current state of the player's inventory, if the player has colored keys, fire boot or flippers, and shows the player the chips they have acquired for them to exit the level.
    displayMap(char[][]) - Method in class Display
    Displaying the current map and its state Each tile is printed to display the map board
    Doors - Class in Unnamed Package
    The Doors class represent the door tiles the player can find in the game.
    Doors(char) - Constructor for class Doors
    Constructor for the Doors class, it accepts the color of the door and sets the locked is true and sets specific color

    E

    EXIT - Static variable in class Tiles
    Exit tile where chip can only enter if he has collected all the required chips inside the map

    F

    findStartPosition() - Method in class Maps
    Finds the starting position for chip to spawn in depending on the map.
    FIRE - Static variable in class Tiles
    Fire tile and chip can only step on them if he has a fire boots object in the inventory
    FIRE_BOOTS - Static variable in class Inventory
    Character symbol representing the fire boots objects
    FLIPPERS - Static variable in class Inventory
    Character symbol representing the flipper objects
    FORCE_DOWN - Static variable in class Tiles
    Force tile downwards, moving chip to the direction down or 'S'
    FORCE_LEFT - Static variable in class Tiles
    Force tile left, moving chip to the direction left or 'A'
    FORCE_RIGHT - Static variable in class Tiles
    Force tile right, moving chip to the direction right or 'D'
    FORCE_UP - Static variable in class Tiles
    Force tile upwards, moving chip to the direction up or 'W'

    G

    generateMap1() - Static method in class Levels
    Current layout for the first map, it is a beginner and teaching level as it only features keys and door tiles Currently has a red key, red door, blue key, blue door, and 4 chips to collect to pass the level
    generateMap2() - Static method in class Levels
    Current layout for the second map, it is a normal level as it features hazard and force tiles Currently has force tiles, flippers, water tiles, fire boots, fire tiles, and 4 chips to pass the level
    generateMap3() - Static method in class Levels
    Current layout for the third map, it is a combination of difficulty for past levels as it features both hazard and force tiles and key and door tiles This map currently has force tiles, flippers, water tiles, fire boots, fire tiles, red key, red door, blue key, blue door and 5 chips to pass the level
    getBlueKeys() - Method in class Inventory
    Determines how many blue keys the player has
    getChips() - Method in class Inventory
    Determines how many chips the player has
    getChips() - Method in class Levels
    Returns the chips required for the map being used
    getCurrentLevel() - Method in class NextLevel
    Gets the current level of the player
    getCurrentMap() - Method in class NextLevel
    Gets the current map level and it gives the clone of it instantly to restore the original state
    getCurrentTileBelow() - Method in class Chip
    Returns chip's current tile below him
    getForceDirection(char) - Static method in class Tiles
    Gets the direction of the force tile
    getInventory() - Method in class Chip
    Returns chip's current inventory
    getMap() - Method in class Levels
    Returns the map layout being used
    getMap() - Method in class Maps
    Returns the current 2d array of characters that represent the current map state of the game
    getRedKeys() - Method in class Inventory
    Determines how many red keys the player has
    getRequiredChips() - Method in class Maps
    Returns the required chips for the player to pass the map
    getStartX() - Method in class Maps
    Returns the starting position of the x-coordinate of the map
    getStartY() - Method in class Maps
    Returns the starting position of the y-coordinate of the map
    getTile(int, int) - Method in class Maps
    Returns the tile type at the specific coordinate located
    getType() - Method in class Tiles
    Gets the specific type of the tile
    getX() - Method in class Chip
    Returns chip's current x-coordinate
    getY() - Method in class Chip
    Returns chip's current y-coordinate

    H

    hasBlueKey() - Method in class Inventory
    Determines if chip has a single blue key
    hasFireBoots() - Method in class Inventory
    Determines if chip has a fire boots
    hasFlippers() - Method in class Inventory
    Determines if chip has a flipper
    hasRedKey() - Method in class Inventory
    Determines if chip has a single red key

    I

    inBounds(int, int) - Method in class Maps
    Checks the boundary rules of the map layout on if the coordinates are within the boundaries of the map
    Inventory - Class in Unnamed Package
    This class is the available inventory of Chip, this class will change its attributes upon collection of items, reset of level, and interacting with doors This class features the use of characters to identify which item will be acquired in the inventory
    Inventory() - Constructor for class Inventory
    Constructor for the Inventory class that automatically sets the inventory to fire boots and flippers to false upon the start of the game
    isAlive() - Method in class Chip
    Returns whether Chip is alive/dead
    isCollectible(char) - Static method in class Tiles
    Determines if the tile is a collectible
    isDoor(char) - Method in class Doors
    Checks if the next tile that chip will step upon is a door object, can be blue or red door
    isForceTile(char) - Static method in class Tiles
    Determines if tile is a force tile
    isLocked() - Method in class Doors
    Checks if the door that chip is interacting with is locked
    isWalkable(char, Inventory, int) - Static method in class Tiles
    Has conditions if hazard tile has been stepped on, requires flippers/fire boots, enables collision on walls, logic for exit tile (chips) and rest of types is walkable

    L

    Levels - Class in Unnamed Package
    This Levels class handles the layout of the maps inside the game.
    Levels(char[][], int) - Constructor for class Levels
    Constructor of Levels class that accepts the given map and chips required to pass the level/map

    M

    main(String[]) - Static method in class Main
    The main static void class to run the program and the different functions of it * @param args - accepts the argument of strings to simulate state of the program
    Main - Class in Unnamed Package
    Main class for the Chips Challenge application.
    Main() - Constructor for class Main
     
    Maps - Class in Unnamed Package
    The Maps class is the one who handles the playable map in the game.
    Maps(char[][], int) - Constructor for class Maps
    Constructor for the Maps class and it creates the Map upon accepting tiles and required chips Also handles on getting the starting position of the map for chip to spawn in
    move(char, Maps) - Method in class Chip
    Moves chip in the direction that depends on the player input.

    N

    NextLevel - Class in Unnamed Package
    The NextLevel class mainly handles the progression and transition of map/level based on the player.
    NextLevel(Maps[], int[]) - Constructor for class NextLevel
    Constructor for the NextLevel class that accepts a map layout and required chips of that specific map

    R

    RED_DOOR - Static variable in class Doors
    Character for Red door tile
    RED_KEY - Static variable in class Inventory
    Character symbol representing the red key objects
    resetInventory() - Method in class Inventory
    When the game calls resetLevel() it resets all the count of the items and the game will restart and simulates game repeat
    revive() - Method in class Chip
    Set chip's attribute "alive" to true, reviving him in the game

    S

    setCurrentTileBelow(char) - Method in class Chip
    Sets chip's current tile below him
    setTile(int, int, char) - Method in class Maps
    Sets the indicated x and y coordinate to the tile type accepted.
    setType(char) - Method in class Tiles
    Sets the tile to a specific type
    setX(int) - Method in class Chip
    Sets chip's current x-coordinate
    setY(int) - Method in class Chip
    Sets chip's current y-coordinate
    showMainMenu(Controller) - Method in class Display
    Method shows the player the main menu of the game, including start game, instructions manual, and exit program options, it will print invalid input if the player inputs an invalid number/character.
    startGame() - Method in class Controller
    Starts this method upon selecting the 1.

    T

    Tiles - Class in Unnamed Package
    The Tiles class represents all the tiles used in the map layouts, it is responsible for giving property of the special tiles including hazard tiles (water and fire), force tiles, and exit tiles.
    Tiles(char) - Constructor for class Tiles
    Constructor for the Tiles class with specified tile type

    U

    unlockDoor(Inventory, char) - Method in class Doors
    Unlocks the door and interacts with the keys of chip, if the specific conditions are met as the door is locked and the player has the specific key, the door will unlock and the method will return true.
    useBlueKey() - Method in class Inventory
    Removes blue key in inventory upon use on blue door
    useRedKey() - Method in class Inventory
    Removes red key in inventory upon use on red door

    W

    WALL - Static variable in class Tiles
    Wall tile where chip cannot pass on through, can also be used for setting map boundary
    WATER - Static variable in class Tiles
    Water tile and chip can only step on them if he has a flipper object in the inventory
